content: Dropbox paper has a really nice feature where if you select a piece of text and paste a link, it linkifies the text (rather than doing a cut and replace). Thoughts on whether we should add a similar feature here?
that's starting to get into the rich-text-editor space, but it could be done.

I should have been clearer, I just meant
1. type check out this link
2. select link with mouse, ctrl-v

should result in check out this [link](https://www.google.com).
Your suggestion would involve using the experimental Selection API, which isn't fully cross-browser compatible (MDN docs)

This happens same in GitHub, when we select text and press Ctr+k.
And also other markdown functions work same like, if we select text and press Ctr+b then it convert message to **message**
We have an issue open for that #5978

ah yeah, I hadn't thought about it, but I guess it is all a part of that same package.
interesting about the IE compatibility. Deponding on what exactly we need, it looks like it might be fine, though?
There's pretty poor mobile support, but I'm not sure if this feature would be often used on mobile
@Cynthia Lin I don't think we need the selection API; $().caret and $().range support this already

I did some experimentation last summer with simple rich-text-editor features like bolding, and it's pretty easy to code up something that works. I didn't pursue it further, though, because of details like hotkey conflicts and lack of real estate in the compose box.
That bottom line area could easily have N widgets added eventually.
